title: Evaluate a multi-variable formula
prompt:
Cece works at a dress shop and needs to calculate the discounts for dresses on sale using this formula:
d = ( p - c ) ÷ 2 where d is the discount, p is the original price, and c is the store’s cost for the dress. If the store’s cost for a dress is $50 and the original price of the dress is $120, what is the discount on the dress?
hint: Substitute the given values for the variables in the equation.
feedback:
To find the answer, use the formula in the problem, <math>
<mrow>
 <mi>d</mi>
 <mo>=</mo>
 <mrow>
  <mo maxsize="1.00em" form="prefix">(</mo>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo>-</mo>
  <mi>c</mi>
  <mo maxsize="1.00em" form="postfix">)</mo>
 </mrow>
 <mo>÷</mo>
 <mn>2</mn>
</mrow>
</math>. The problem gives the value of <math><mi>p</mi></math>, $120, and the value of <math><mi>c</mi></math>, $50. The discount will equal $120 minus $50, divided by two. The answer is $35.
